Package fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition

Class FlagParcelDecomposition

java.lang.Object
fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition.FlagParcelDecomposition
public class FlagParcelDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
Re-implementation of block decomposition into parcels with flag shape. The algorithm is an adaptation from :

Vanegas, C. A., Kelly, T., Weber, B., Halatsch, J., Aliaga, D. G., MÃ¼ller, P., May 2012. Procedural generation of parcels in urban modeling. Comp. Graph. Forum 31 (2pt3).

As input a polygon that represents the zone to decompose. For each step the decomposition is processed according to the OBBBlockDecomposition algorithm If one of the parcels do not have access to the road, a L parcel is created. A road is added on the other parcel according to 1/ the shortest path to the public road 2/ if this shortest path does not intersect an existing building. The width of the road is parametrable in the attributes : roadWidth

It is a recursive method, the decomposition is stop when a stop criteria is reached either the area or roadwidthaccess is below a given threshold

Author:
Mickael Brasebin

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static double TOO_SMALL_PARCEL_AREA
    We remove silver parts that may have a too small area inferior to 25

  • Constructor Details

    • FlagParcelDecomposition

      public FlagParcelDecomposition​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon p, org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection buildings, double maximalArea, double maximalWidth, double drivewayWidth)
      Flag decomposition algorithm method without buildings, roads and exclusion geometry
      Parameters:
      p - the initial polygon to decompose
      buildings - the buildings that will constraint the possibility of adding a road
      maximalArea - the maximalArea for a parcel
      maximalWidth - the maximal width
      drivewayWidth - the width of the created driveway

    • FlagParcelDecomposition

      public FlagParcelDecomposition​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon parcelGeom, java.lang.Double maximalArea, java.lang.Double maximalWidth, java.lang.Double drivewayWidth, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> islandExterior, org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry exclusionZone)
      Constructor of a FlagParcelDecomposition method without buildings and roads
      Parameters:
      parcelGeom - the initial polygon to decompose
      maximalArea - the maximalArea for a parcel
      maximalWidth - the maximal width
      drivewayWidth - the width of driveways
      islandExterior - the exterior of this island to assess road access
      exclusionZone - a zone to find roads from empty parcels area

      Parameters:

      maximalArea - the maximalArea for a parcel
      maximalWidth - the maximal width
      drivewayWidth - the width of driveways
      islandExterior - the exterior of this island to assess road access

  • Method Details

    • generateFlagSplitedParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection generateFlagSplitedParcels​(org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection parcelSFC, java.io.File buildingFile, java.io.File roadFile, fr.ign.artiscales.tools.parameter.ProfileUrbanFabric profile) throws java.io.IOException
      Main way to access to the flag parcel split algorithm.
      Parameters:
      parcelSFC - parcels to cut
      buildingFile - building that could stop the creation of a driveway
      roadFile - complementary roads (as line and not as parcel void)
      profile - type of ProfileUrbanFabric to simulate
      Returns:
      collection of cut parcels
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - reading buildingFile

    • generateFlagSplitedParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection generateFlagSplitedParcels​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature feat, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extLines, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.lang.Double maximalAreaSplitParcel, java.lang.Double maximalWidthSplitParcel, java.lang.Double lenDriveway, org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry exclusionZone)
      Flag parcel split with no buildings and no road.
      Parameters:
      feat - parcel to cut
      extLines - block contour
      harmonyCoeff - possibility for parcel to be elongated or not
      noise - randomness in the parcel creation process
      maximalAreaSplitParcel - area under which a parcel won't be cut anymore
      maximalWidthSplitParcel - with between road and parcel under which parcel won't be cut anymore
      lenDriveway - length of the driveway to simulate
      exclusionZone - Zone to consider as not existing
      Returns:
      collection of cut parcels
